moves.1. d4 d5 2. c4 e6 3. cxd5 exd5 4. Nc3 c6: I don't know the theory of this line of the QGD / exchange but I prefer Black since White's kingside weakness looks real.
moves.12. Qc2: Black could grab a pawn by Nxg4, I didn't even consider it at the time.
moves.12... Ne4 13. O-O: I prefer 0-0-0 castle at least then white could press a kingside attack without a expose king on that side.
moves.13... Rxh3 14. Nxe4 dxe4 15. Qxe4+ Qe7 1: Material is even but hard to tell who is better.
moves.17. Kg2 Rah8 18. Rfh1 Rh3xh1 19. Rxh1 Rx: White's rook trades have left his king farther away from the center in the endgame.
moves.20... c5 21. a3 Be1 22. Kg2 cxd4 23. Nxd: A mistake - trying to correct the placement of his worst piece but allows a pawn to fall.
moves.24... Bc1 25. b3 Bxa3 26. Ke2 a6: A small step to limit the power of white's knight.
moves.27. Bc7 Nf6: Strengthing the knight with gain of time.
moves.28. f3 Nd5 29. Ba5 Bb4 30. Bxb4+ Nxb4: Black has reduce the endgame to Knights with a pawn up.
moves.31. e4 Nc6 32. Nxc6+: Keeping the Knights on looks like a better way to gain drawing chances.
